title: So. League has devolved to this....
body:
I'm not even gonna appeal to league at this rate. It has gotten beyond dumb so I'm hopeful Im banned outright shortly. 
As such I will show you how stupid rito chatbans people.

You claim math and dont blame anyone. Yeah. You get chat banned. F* you RITO. Im done. 

Game 1
Pre-Game
DJ Acceso: going tank
In-Game
DJ Acceso: no
DJ Acceso: ur in my jg
DJ Acceso: u just dont know it yet
DJ Acceso: k so mid has tunnel vision
DJ Acceso: ff at 15 pls
DJ Acceso: swain ur the only one doing well
DJ Acceso: other 2 lanes are scrubby
DJ Acceso: k
DJ Acceso: just watching u guys lose from now on
DJ Acceso: u play like a blind
DJ Acceso: why should i? u cant push lane
DJ Acceso: top is winning lane
DJ Acceso: i would "counter" gank if i went top
DJ Acceso: that is why
DJ Acceso: ff at 15
DJ Acceso: im fine with being baf
DJ Acceso: bad*
DJ Acceso: i just know a bad team
DJ Acceso: 9:2
DJ Acceso: blame jg
DJ Acceso: i get it
DJ Acceso: yup i cant do anything with this team
DJ Acceso: yes yes
DJ Acceso: i get it
DJ Acceso: blame jg
DJ Acceso: heard it countless times
DJ Acceso: the lanes i did try to gank i died
DJ Acceso: youre welcome
DJ Acceso: lucky they were dumb on that play
DJ Acceso: idc
DJ Acceso: lol
DJ Acceso: they cant even lane
DJ Acceso: idc if u report
DJ Acceso: thats the problem
DJ Acceso: :)
DJ Acceso: just told u that 10 min ago
DJ Acceso: lol
DJ Acceso: this guy doesnt get it
DJ Acceso: i saw it early
DJ Acceso: too fed
DJ Acceso: 18:4
DJ Acceso: k so 0:4 adc
DJ Acceso: 2:3 gp who i helped secure kills
DJ Acceso: 1:5 feeding swain
DJ Acceso: im just being real
DJ Acceso: just numbers brah
DJ Acceso: im just describing math
DJ Acceso: u seem mad
DJ Acceso: lol
DJ Acceso: youll soon see it is
DJ Acceso: im not even being competitive
DJ Acceso: im just giving u numbers
DJ Acceso: thats all
DJ Acceso: 22:4
DJ Acceso: 23*
Post-Game
DJ Acceso: not sure why this game was played lol


I wont get too deep in the weeds but every lane but top was losing (alot) and he wasnt winning either. 
By the end of the game all of them fed their asses off.

Please note only 1 game... as usual 
If u call someone newb you can get the chat ban.
If you call someone dumb you get the chat ban.

I have multiple frivolous complaints about stating the obvious and getting a chat ban.

Do with it what you will, im personally not invested either way. I just wanted to show you what you can get level 0 for. August 27th is when i go either way. :)

I'm confused as to why this would not merit a punishment in your eyes?

you didnt make your point. no one was flamed.

keep in mind. we are leaving out THEIR messages! (jg is always at fault amiright?)

It doesn't matter what they said, you do not get to flame/blame them or give up and be negative in chat.

This **IS** flaming and blaming, whether you accept it or not.

list one line that i flamed....

simple. cant be done. you can go away now

bad matchups occur. and it happens. nothing about the people playing. just crap rito matchups. i didnt blame anyone.

"mid has tunnel vision"

> [{quoted}](name=rujitra,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=i0A5APkx,comment-id=00000000000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-08-21T01:52:03.372+0000)

so....

bring in the other messages to bring it in to context?
nah you wouldnt do that.

either way. on it's own that is what u have?
What do you think that you're gaining out of being rude to your teammates? Like pointing out scores and constantly saying things like "can't do anything with this team" doesn't help anyone....

> [{quoted}](name=Zardo,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=i0A5APkx,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-08-21T01:44:23.953+0000)
>
> What do you think that you're gaining out of being rude to your teammates? Like pointing out scores and constantly saying things like "can't do anything with this team" don't help anyone....

we all have matchups where we cant do anything because rito has their mm system. its nothing against the players. its just how we were dealt the cards. Not sure if you played more than a few games to understand this.
Do you think pointing out how they're playing is going to make them somehow play better?
More like, so YOU have devolved to this. Playing the blame game. Constantly bitching. Im sorry you have become what people hate about the league community.

You came here, you wanted an explanation, you got one. Yes, repeating the score and pointing out every little mistake is annoying. You may not like it, but those are the facts. 

You can accept them or keep calling people kids and learn nothing.

You repeatedly call for a forfeit in chat, you call your teammates "blind" and "bad," you argued and complained the whole time, you harassed your team by throwing their scores in their faces.

Your opinion of the rules is of zero relevance. When a cop stops you for going 40 in a 25 zone, you can claim "I think the limit should be 45 here" all you want. You're still getting a ticket. If a librarian asks you to keep your voice down while you use the facilities, shouting that libraries should be loud will simply get you escorted out. If you go to a friend's house who insists that you remove your shoes while you're in their home, "that's a stupid rule and I do what I want" will lose you a friend. If you are using someone else's services, facilities, equipment, etc., you abide by their rules or you deal with the consequences. If you think the rules should change, that is a completely different conversation (and I wouldn't give a plugged nickel for your chances at convincing Riot to change their rules to allow behavior like yours).

From [Riot's support knowledgebase](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/360024051193-Understanding-Different-Ban-Types-FAQs):

> We work with the overall community and within our own company guidelines to identify what disruptive behavior is and what the consequences for those behaviors should be. We understand that it can be difficult to know where the line is, which is why we provide chat logs and we have a few tiers in the ban process in order to allow for you to learn and grow.

There is nothing in Riot's behavioral rules that excuses toxic chat as long as it's factual. It's technically possible for someone to literally be matched with the worst player on the planet, but there's no reason to spend the match calling them the worst player on the planet. It won't make them better at LoL, it won't make them feel better, and it won't help you win the match. All it will do is make them feel worse, annoy your team, and get you punished for breaking the rules, "facts" or not. It's technically true that 2+2=4, but if you announce that fact to your team every four seconds, that's spam and it will annoy them until they mute you, followed by a report and a punishment. It's a true fact, but spamming it is still punishable. Announcing a struggling teammate's score every time they die might be a recitation of fact, but all that does is harass the teammate by calling attention to their poor performance. It won't improve their performance; it might actually exacerbate the problem by tilting them. Scores are factual, but that doesn't make it okay to harass someone.

You weren't punished for misbehaving in one game. You were punished for misbehaving in _one more_ game, in a consistent pattern of negative behavior that breaks the game's rules. Additionally, the reform card doesn't always show all the logs that led to your punishment: it randomly selects up to several logs. You might see three logs, but you also might see as few as one, even for players whose punishment stems not from a small number of egregious infractions but rather from dozens of instances of mild toxicity. The purpose of the reform card is to tell you how to reform, so it shows you an example of the behavior that prompted your punishment and explains that such behavior is inappropriate and should be avoided if you want to maintain an account in good standing.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=i0A5APkx,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-08-21T01:48:06.648+0000)
>
> You repeatedly call for a forfeit in chat, you call your teammates "blind" and "bad," you argued and complained the whole time, you harassed your team by throwing their scores in their faces.
> 
> Your opinion of the rules is of zero relevance. When a cop stops you for going 40 in a 25 zone, you can claim "I think the limit should be 45 here" all you want. You're still getting a ticket. If a librarian asks you to keep your voice down while you use the facilities, shouting that libraries should be loud will simply get you escorted out. If you think the rules should change, that is a completely different conversation (and I wouldn't give a plugged nickel for your chances at convincing Riot to change their rules to allow behavior like yours).
> 
> From [Riot's support knowledgebase](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/360024051193-Understanding-Different-Ban-Types-FAQs):
> 
> There is nothing in Riot's behavioral rules that excuses toxic chat as long as it's factual. It's technically possible for someone to literally be matched with the worst player on the planet, but there's no reason to spend the match calling them the worst player on the planet. It won't make them better at LoL, it won't make them feel better, and it won't help you win the match. All it will do is make them feel worse, annoy your team, and get you punished for breaking the rules, "facts" or not. It's technically true that 2+2=4, but if you announce that fact to your team every four seconds, that's spam and it will annoy them until they mute you, followed by a report and a punishment. It's a true fact, but spamming it is still punishable. Announcing a struggling teammate's score every time they die might be a recitation of fact, but all that does is harass the teammate by calling attention to their poor performance. It won't improve their performance; it might actually exacerbate the problem by tilting them. Scores are factual, but that doesn't make it okay to harass someone.
> 
> You weren't punished for misbehaving in one game. You were punished for misbehaving in _one more_ game, in a consistent pattern of negative behavior that breaks the game's rules. Additionally, the reform card doesn't always show all the logs that led to your punishment: it randomly selects up to several logs. You might see three logs, but you also might see as few as one, even for players whose punishment stems not from a small number of egregious infractions but rather from dozens of instances of mild toxicity. The purpose of the reform card is to tell you how to reform, so it shows you an example of the behavior that prompted your punishment and explains that such behavior is inappropriate and should be avoided if you want to maintain an account in good standing.

Show the class what we get banned for kids. :)
